Cranberry/orange loaf or muffins

•2 cups all-purpose flour
•1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
•1/2 teaspoon baking soda
•1/2 teaspoon salt
•1 tablespoon grated orange zest
•1 1/2 cups fresh cranberries
•1/2 cup pecans, coarsely chopped
•1/4 cup margarine, softened
•1 cup white sugar
•1 egg
•3/4 cup orange juice

1.Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9×5 inch loaf pan. Whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Stir in orange zest, cranberries, and pecans. Set aside.\n2.In a large bowl, cream together margarine, sugar, and egg until smooth. Stir in orange juice. Beat in flour mixture until just moistened. Pour into prepared pan.\n3.Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the bread springs back when lightly touched. Let stand 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool. Wrap in plastic when completely cool.
Vegi Frankies

For The Rotis
1/2cup - plain flour (maida)
1/4cup - whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
1tsp - oil
salt to taste
1/4tsp - oil for kneading
butter for cooking
For The Stuffing
1 1/2tbsp - oil or butter
1tsp - ginger-garlic (adrak-lehsun) paste
1 3/4cups - boiled , peeled and mashed potatoes
3/4tsp - chilli powder
1 tsp garam masala
1/2tsp - chaat masala (optional)
1tbsp - finely chopped coriander (dhania)
salt to taste
To Be Mixed Into Masala Water
(makes approx 1/3 cup)
1 1/2tsp - dried mango powder (amchur)
1/2tsp - chilli powder
1/4tsp - garam masala
salt to taste
1/3cup - water
Other Ingredients
4tsp - butter for cooking
1cup - finely chopped onions
4tsp - frankie masal
(readily available in the market) or chaat masala
For Serving
tomato sauce

For the rotis
•Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and knead into a soft and pliable dough using enough water. Cover the dough with a wet muslin cloth and keep aside for 10 minutes.
•Cover the dough with a wet muslin cloth and keep aside for 10 minutes.
•Knead again using ¼ tsp of oil till it is smooth and elastic.
•Divide the dough into 4 equal portions and roll out each into approx. 200 mm. (8″) diameter thin circle.
•Heat a tava (griddle) and cook each roti lightly on a medium flame and keep aside.
For the stuffing
•Heat the oil/butter in a kadhai, add the ginger-garlic paste and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds.
•Add the potatoes, chilli powder, garam masala, chaat masala, coriander and salt, mix well and sauté on a medium flame for another minute. Keep aside.
How to proceed
•Heat ½ tsp butter on a tava (griddle), place ¼ th of the stuffing and cook on a medium flame till both sides turn light brown in color. Keep aside.
•Place a roti on the tava (griddle) and cook on a medium flame using ½ tsp butter till both sides turn light brown in color.
•Place the stuffing on one end of the roti, spread it lightly and remove from the tava.
•Place it on a clean, dry surface and top with ¼ cup of onions, sprinkle 1½ tsp of masala water and ½ tsp of chaat masala evenly over it and roll it up tightly.
•Fold the edges at one end and wrap in an aluminium foil/tissue paper and serve immediately with tomato sauce.
•Repeat with the remaining ingredients to make 3 more frankies.
Rice flakes with Milk
1 Cup – Milk\n1/2 cup – Poha/atukulu\n1/2 tbs – jaggery/bellem/gud
1. Take a bowl and add the Milk, poha and jaggery.\n2. Keep the bowl in Micro-oven for 2 min and its ready to eat.
Pepper and Onion Frittata

8 eggs
3 tablespoons refined oil
1/4 cup milk
2 medium bell peppers, seeds and membranes removed, sliced thinly into 1 ½-inch long pieces
2 tablespoons coarsely chopped parsley
1 medium yellow onion, thinly sliced
1 teaspoon salt, divided
Pinch red-pepper flakes (optional)

1.Heat oven to 375 degrees with rack in top third.
2.In a large mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, parsley, and ½ teaspoon salt; season with pepper.
3.Heat oil in a 10-inch ovenproof sauté pan over medium.
4.Add peppers, onions, and red-pepper flakes (pan will be very full); sprinkle with remaining ½ teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring often, until vegetables are completely tender and all the released liquid has evaporated, about 10 to 15 minutes. (If vegetables begin to stick or brown too quickly, reduce heat to medium-low.)
5.Reduce heat to low and pour egg mixture evenly over peppers.
6.Cook for 5 minutes to allow the edges to set, then transfer pan to the oven.
7.Cook until edges of frittata are lightly golden and the center is set, about 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let rest for at least 5 to 10 minutes before unmolding.
8.8. To unmold frittata: invert it over a plate and then flip it again over another plate so it is right-side up. Serve hot or at room temperature.
Lachha Parata

whole wheat flour - 2 cups
Water - to make dough
Salt - to taste
ghee (clarified butter) - 1 cup

1. Take a bowl and mix the flour and salt and knead into a soft dough with a little water at a time. Keep aside.
2. Mix 3 Table Spoons of ghee with 1 Table Spoon of flour and keep aside.
3. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Divide each ball into 2 portions.
4. Take each portion and roll into a long, finger-thick noodle shape.
5. Coil the first shape into a spiral.
6. Flour a rolling surface lightly and very gently roll out the spiral into a flat circle about 5″ in diameter (1/3″ thick).
7. Grease the top surface with the ghee-flour mix.
8. Roll the next shape in the same way and place over the first circle. This makes one Lachha Paratha. Make up all the remaining dough the same way.
9. Heat a flat pan on a medium flame.
10. Fry each paratha like this: After placing it on the pan the first time, turn after 30 seconds. Spread ghee on the top surface and turn again. Grease the side now on top. Turn often and fry till crisp and golden.
11. The resulting paratha will be crisp, layered and flaky!
12. Now serve the paratas hot with aloo kurma
Makki Ka Roti

Mature mustard greens - 750 gms
Spinach greens - 250 gms 
Makki ka atta - 1/3 Cups
Unsalted butter or ghee - 2 Tsp
Grated ginger - 2 Tsp
Chopped onion - 1 Cup
Chopped tomatoes - 1 Cup
Slit green chillies - 3
Salt - to taste
Additional butter or ghee - for serving

1. Wash the greens, including the tougher stems, and chop very fine.
2. Pressure cook with a little water till tender. Alternately, cook covered over gentle heat till tender.
3. Mash with a wooden roller, or use a handheld blender, taking care to not make a fine puree.
4. Put it back on the stove to simmer. Stir in corn flour and cook till creamy.
5. Traditionally, saag is prepared in large quantities to be consumed over a few days.
6. The thadka is added only to the portion that is being served.
7. I find it stays well for a couple of days even if you add the thadka to the entire quantity.
8. For preparing the thadka, heat butter or ghee in a pan .
9. Add ginger, followed by chopped onions, and cook till the onions are transparent.
10. Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring constantly over medium heat, till the tomatoes are mushy and the fat has risen to the surface.
11. Add slit green chillies and stir.
12. Add the cooked greens and salt, and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
13. Serve hot with Makki ki roti.
14. Corn tortillas should be a reasonably good substitute for the corn rotis.

All Purpose Flour - 2 cups
Yoghurt - 3/4 cup
Baking Soda - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Sugar - 1 Table Spoon
Vegetable Oil - for frying
Salt - to taste

1. Sieve the flour and then mix it with baking soda and salt.
2. Mix yoghurt and sugar and add to the flour
3. Add enough lukewarm water and knead it into soft dough
4. Cover the dough with a wet cloth and keep it aside in warm place for fermentation for about 3-4 hours
5. Divide it into equal portions, roll them into balls.
6. Cover and set aside for 5 minutes
7. Flatten the balls by pressing in between the greased palms
8. Roll into 5-6 inch diameter (like big puri).
9. Heat oil in a Kadai and deep fry on high flame.
10. Serve hot with chhole

Vermicelli - 1 cup
Yogurt - 4 cups
Mustard seeds – 1 Tea Spoon
Cumin seeds – 1 Tea Spoon
Black gram - 1 Tea Spoon
Bengal gram - 1 Tea Spoon
Red chillis - 2
Green chillis - 2
Curry leaves - 5
Salt – as per taste
Pepper corns - 1 Tea Spoon
Coriander leaves - few
Turmeric - pinch
Oil - 2 Table Spoon

1) Take a bowl and boil vermicelli by adding little salt and oil to it.
2) Drain the excess water after the bambino gets boiled
3) Beat the yogurt finely and add the boiled vermicelli to the beaten yogurt by adding finely chopped green chillis
4) Take a frying pan and put oil in it and heat.
5) After the oil gets heated add black gram, Bengal gram, mustard seeds, red chillis, pepper corns and sauté till they turn golden brown.
6) Later curry leaves to it and sauté .
7) Add the tampering to the vermicelli curd mixture and mix well.
8) Add sufficient salt and turmeric to it.
9) Add water also if necessary
10) Now the delicious and healthy vermicelli dadojanam was ready to eat.
Paneer Dosa

Rice - 3 cups
split black gram lentil - 1 cup
fenugreek seeds - 1 Tea Spoon
potato - 400 Grams 
large sized onions - 
paneer - 150 Grams
green chillies - 3
mustard seeds - 1 Tea Spoon
turmeric powder - 1/4 Tea Spoon
curry leaves - few
oil - as required
salt - 1 1/2 Tea Spoon

1. Soak rice, dal and Fenu Greek seeds for 6 hours.
2. Then grind them in to a fine thin batter by adding little water.
3. Add salt to it and leave it covered for 12 hours for fermentation.
4. Peel potato and cut into small pieces.
5. Chop onion also into long pieces.
6. Grate paneer and keep aside
7. Finely chop the green chillis also.
8. Heat 2 Table Spoons of oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and curry leaves to it let them splutter
9. Then fry onion in it until it turns light brown.
10. Now put potato pieces , green chillis and paneer and mix well.
11. Now put 1/2 Tea Spoon of salt, red chilli powder and turmeric in it.
12. Fry for 2 minutes and remove it from the flame. Keep it aside for stuffing.
13. Now heat a non stick tawa and spread 1 tbsp of the batter on the whole of the pan.
14. When cooked spread paneer mixture on it.
15. Grease all the corners with oil.
16. Roll and remove it from the gas.
17. Put little water on the tawa and wipe it with a clean cloth before making each dosa.
18. Serve them hot with hot sambhar and chutney
Noodles Omelette

4 Eggs
1 onion (finely chopped)
1/2 cup noodles boiled
1 table spoon green coriander finely chopped
2 table spoon cheeses grated
1 tea spoon green green chillies finely chopped
2 table spoons butter or Oil
Salt to taste
1/2 Tea spoon black pepper powder

1. Break eggs and beat till puffy. Mix noodles, onion, green coriander and black pepper to the beaten eggs\n2. Heat butter or oil in a frying pan. mix salt and pour the egg mixture in a pan. Sprinkle black pepper and cheese and cook omelette on low heat from both sides.\n3. Serve hot with sauce or chutney.
Omelette packet with Paneer

2 eggs
1 medium size onion (finely chopped)
2 green chillies (finely chopped)
1 table spoon green coriander finely chopped
3/4 tea spoon black pepper
2 table spoon milk
250 grams fresh paneer
2 cheese slices
2 table spoon butter
Salt to taste

1. Cut paneer to the size of cheese slices
2. Break eggs and keep yolks and whites separately. Mix two table spoons of milk and beat the white till puffy. Add yolk and beat again.
3. Melt a table spoon full of butter in a frying pan. Add 1/2 of chopped onion, 1/2 of chopped green chillies and 1/2 of green coriander to the beaten egg and prepare an omelette
4. Sprinkle 1/2 of salt and black pepper on the omelette and fry both the sides. Put paneer slices in the centre and fold the omelette like a packet from all the sides towards the centre.
5. Serve this omelette packet with salad
6. Prepare other omelettes the same way.
Mixed Vegetable with Oats Dosa

Oats – 2 cups
rice flour - 1/4 cup
roasted semolina - 2 Table Spoon wheat - 2 Table Spoon 
Grated onion - 1 cup
Grated Carrot - 1/2cup
Garlic-ginger paste - 1 Tea Spoon 
Pepper and cumin powder - 2 Tea Spoons 
Green chillies - 3-4 (chopped)
Coriander Leaves - few
Salt - to taste
. Take a bowl and mix all the above ingredients well by adding water to get a thick consistency\n2. Now proceed like a usual dosa preparation.\n3. Serve with any chutney
Biscuit Roti

Maida - 4 cups
Semolina - 1 cup
Fresh coconut - 4 Table Spoon (grated)
Green chillies - 4
Red chilli powder - 1 Tea Spoon
Mustard seeds - 1 Tea Spoon
Curry leaves - few
Salt - to taste
Oil - for deep fry

1. Sieve the flour and add salt to taste.
2. Add hot water and little hot cooking oil to prepare a smooth dough.
3. Keep aside.
4. Take a pan and heat1 Table Spoon of oil in it.
5. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter, then add the minced green chillies and curry leaves and saute. Then add the chilli powder and semolina and saute
6. When the semolina starts turning color(about 2mins,sprinkle some water(about 1/4 cup) and add the salt and coconut.
7. Cook for about 5-6 minutes on a low flame.
8. Remove from the flame and let it cool.
9. Make small rounds of this semolina stuffing.
10. Now make maida dough in to small round balls and press the ball in between your palm in to flat circles. Keep the semolina stuffing in the center and fold the rounds till the stuffing is completely sealed inside.
11. Roll out into small circles using a rolling pin.
12. Bring the cooking oil to smoking point and deep fry these till golden brown and crisp.
13. Eat when hot with tomato ketchup.
Kanchipuram Idlies

Raw rice - 1 Cup
Idly Rice – 1 Cup
Black gram dal – 1 Cup
Bengal gram dal – 1 Tea Spoon
Mustard seeds – 1 Tea Spoon
Ginger – 2 Tea Spoons (finely chopped)
Red Chilly - 5
Pepper - 1 Tea Spoon
Curry leaf - few
Salt – to taste
Oil - 1 Table Spoon
Ghee - to grease idly plates

1. Wash and soak raw rice and idly rice together for about 3 hours.
 2. Wash and soak black gram dal for an hour before you start grinding
 3. Grind the rice and black gram dal separately.
4. The batter should not be too watery. Take care while adding water.
5. Rice should be ground to coarse consistency.
6. Add salt and mix well.
7. Allow the contents to ferment for about 8 hours.
8. In a pan add oil and heat it. Add Bengal gram dal, Black gram dal, mustard seeds, pepper, 
ginger, chilly and curry leaf.
9. Fry well and mix it to the fermented batter.
10. Grease the idly plate with ghee before you start making idlies.
11. Once the cooking is done, leave the plate to cool down. Then take out the idlies.
12. Serve hot with peanut chutney
Omelette Rolls

4 eggs beaten
¼ cup onion chopped
¼ cup capsicum chopped
¼ cup paneer grated
¼ cup milk maid
2 potatoes boiled
1 table spoon each red and green chillies chopped
¾ table spoon black pepper powder
Oil in sufficient quantity
Salt: to taste

1.Beat the eggs.
2.Add salt and pepper powder and prepare 4 large omelettes.
3.Heat 1 table spoon of oil. Mix chopped onion and capsicum with it and sauté well till tender.
4.Add boiled potatoes, paneer, milk maid, mirchi, salt and pepper etc to make a paste
5.Stuff the paste in omelletes and role it.
Cashew Utaapam

Rice - 2 cup
Split black gram - 1 cup
Onion - 2
Tomato - 2
Green chili - 2
Ginger - a piece
Coriander leaves - 1 Tea Spoon
Cashew nut - 15-16
Salt - 1 Tea Spoon
Oil - for cooking

1. Soak rice and dal separately for about 6 hours.
2. Then grind them separately.
3. Mix them in a container and add salt.
4. Cover and leave for fermentation for 12 hours.
5. Finely chop ginger, onion, green chilli, tomato and coriander leaves.
6. Cut Cashew nut also into pieces.
7. Mix red chilli powder in rice batter.
8. Heat a non stick pan/tawa and spread 1 tbsp batter on it.
9. Spread chopped vegetables and Cashew nut on it.
10. Cook at low flame and grease it on the corners and turn it to cook the other side.
11. If the batter sticks on a tawa, add little salt to the oil and grease the corners so that Uttapam will not stick on tawa.
12. Cook it at low flame to make it tastier.
13. Serve it hot.
